It feels like Star Trek, but with a whole new universe to explore and full of interesting lore. Dialogue is the strongest point of this game. It feels almost natural, despite some awkwardness with transitions. It lets you feel like you have a real impact on your environment. I told people I would 'shut up' a crazy guy, and Shepard goes over and hits him on the head, knocking him out! Mass Effect is all about choices and shows you the consequences of your actions.   However, the action is a little clunky. It's slow to tactically command your squad, and sometimes they move despite their orders. The Mako is remarkably awkward. Pressing only the left or right arrow key moves the vehicle forward in a turn that direction. No gravity effects of being on different planets was noticeable (even though this would have been a great opportunity to bring joy to exploring). Most of the worlds without side missions are canned and practically identical.  That being said, the side missions and the main missions are all wonderful. They have well designed, if linear, levels. Some side missions have multiple solutions.  All in all, a great game for sci-fi enthusiasts: 7/10

To start off with, I am a huge fan of the Mass Effect series and have played every game at least twice. But that was on my Xbox 360, before I got my gaming rig. So a few days ago I thought I would replay the triology and rediscover the Mass Effect universe, but this time on PC. There is not that much thats different between this version and the console one. But there are advantages and disadvantages. One advantage is because you are using a keyboard you have access to the powers of your character as hotkeys, making the gameplay more fluent. Another advantage is that you can install mods, for example the texture overhaul mod which makes the game look a bit better. One disadvantage is that this game is honestly not that well optimized. I've encounted several bugs and the game crashes on different occations which sometimes makes it tedious playing through the game when you have to repeat a section again. A problem that both the console and PC version shares is the texture pop-ins that occurs in almost every level of the game.   But I prefer the PC version just because you can make the game look better and because you get to use in my opinion the superior input (mouse & keyboard).   TL;DR: Awesome story, okay gameplay, but be prepared to deal with some crashes and bugs!

Mass Effect... What is there to say about Mass Effect that hasn't already been said? It's a brilliant Space Fantasy Role-Playing game set in the distant future starring a party of misfit Extraterrestrials and Commander Shepard... who can Fight like a Krogan and Run like a leopard. It's good on the first playthrough, but that's really about it since most of the game will inevitably end up being the same no matter what choices or gender you choose in subsequent replays. Don't get me wrong, the first playthrough is an epic Space Fantasy RPG in the same vein as Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (note to self, replay KOTOR) and developed by the same team, it just suffers from the SSDD of being an RPG where most game resources are recycled at least 6 dozen times.   I give Mass Effect a 7.6/10 It's a decent space fantasy Role-Playing game, but I didn't like it THAT much (Same-gender lovin' courtesy of an Asari you rescue from a trap only gives so many extra points)

There are only two gripes that I have with this game. First is the inventory system. You will spend A LOT of time selling or trashing Weapons, Armors and Upgrades. You will loot THOUSANDS of terrible items and only about 100 usefull items throughout the whole game. There are ammo upgrades that do extra damage to Organic enemies and Synthetic enemies, but you'll fight large amounts of Organics one second and large amounts or Synthetics the next second. It gets annoying to keep switching out these ammos when you can just equip Toxic ammo to do extra damage to all targets all the time. Making the ammo upgrades pretty useless. There isn't a whole lot of choice with the inventory system. Of course you want to have the best stuff at all times, so forceing the player to open the inventory and sift through all of the useless stuff to find one or two upgrades is just pointless busy work. There's just not enough depth in the items to justify needing an whole inventory system. Which is probably why the later entries into the Mass Effect Franchise ditched the inventory system in favor of the load out system. Where you just bring 4 or 5 weapons on a mission and just use those until you unlocked something better.  My second gripe is with the vehicle exploration. The vehicle exploration is pretty annoying because the physics are just terrible and there are alot of planets that are full of jagged hillls so traversing those planets becomes annoying VERY quickly.

Notable for its asperations than its achievements, Mass Effect was the first in a series that would help define a console generation and Bioware's new direction. Loving nods to scifi giants--from Doc Smith to Star Trek to Aliens--and art & sound direction that breaks the then-dominant space marine glut (and fallen back to as the series goes on) can inspire nostalgia for a lot of fans. Unfortunately gameplay doesn't quite live up to the promise, with multiple systems ranging from combat, exploration, inventory, and level design (yes, I know that's not a system) betraying their lack of experience/expertise outside of RPGs at that point.  Still, for anyone interested in the story of the Mass Effect story should start here, if for no other reason than to appreciate the rather drastic evolution the series undergoes.

Don't get me wrong though, Mass Effect still has its positives. Its story was awesome and the crew that accompanies you is filled with well written and likable characters. The game is one worth noting if you are willing to work your way through its gameplay for the story.

Oh bioware. What's not to love about this classic? Space exploration, interesting (and fun!) sidequests, lovely characters.... And the facts that your choices actually matter. Overall, a 9/10 Tali best space waifu (I know you can't romance her in this one, but i don't care)

The first game in the series, but well worth playing. I played this game right before the second game was released and I was hooked. Playing the games in order is strongly recommend since the story builds, but this game and story were a lot of fun. If you ike mass effect then play this game. If you never played mass effect then start with this game and then play 2 & 3. It will be well worth your time.

Probably the best game i have ever played and i think is the best in the ME trilogy. The RPG elements combined with third person shooter elements is perfectly balanced out here. The wide array of characters are given plenty of depth and that combined with the brilliabt dialogue wheel and fantastic writing and delivery from the voice actors makes this a highly recommended game to almost any type of gaming fan.   Exploring a wide array of planets that are wonderfully designed is also fantastic. The Mako exploration vehicle can be diffucult to manouver sometimes and has some graphical problems occasionally, but those are only minor issues and doesn't effect the quality of the game that much.  Pros:  Character depth Fantastic, well thought out story that you can get really emotionally invested in like in those certain movies and books. Dialogue conversation wheel Many of the choices you can make carry on over to later on in this game and the latter two in the series Great voice acting Graphics
The best game ever made. That is all.

For this reason I will now be importing my save to ME2 cuz I heard that being unfaithy to your ME1 intrest can lead to negitive effects in ME3(Yes 3).  -Saves (This is more of a personal problem then anything but, THE AUTO SAVES ARE TOO SPACED OUT!!! Once i got past the first initial story and out into space i fell in love with this game. I admit this game isn't perfect, I think they could improve on it ten fold but the story is interesting and its worth the money.  It lacks creativity from the developers, there isnt enough smart AI and the planets and buildings are the same. I dont know what the budget was but I hope they made enough to have made the second even better. I like the story choice system and the good/bad reputation. I love the game and i am 100% hooked.

The best game in the trilogy in terms of lore, and probably the only RPG oriented game of the three. The combat isn't very refined like its successors and it can be a little glitchy at times, but in regards to storytelling, the game excels. Moreover, whatever choices your character makes whether it's inconsequential or not, carries over to the sequels.   If an engrossing storyline replete with lore and a very enjoyable RPG experience is enough to pique your interest, then this game is for you.

Hands-down best Sci-fi game I've played. Deep lore and nice RPG system with just a dash of shooter in it. A nice mess of systems. Every playthrough I do I feel as if I discover something new I havent seen before. Some people have books they read every year, this is my game I play through once a year

Certain game mechanics now feel dated (breaking things down into omni gel is *not* the highlight of this game), but the worldbuilding not only holds up, but is still one of the best examples of the genre. TL:DR If you like Space Operas, this is it.    I found the story very satisfying, immersive and engaging. The voice acting is superb. The Mass Effect Universe is a fun place to explore and discover. The setting, story, character and themes are the game's strongest assets. I played through as a soldier. The cover based gunplay is fun but the heat buildup + accuracy decay (and no ammo) approach to weapons is less desirable than the alternative. I'm glad they dropped it from the sequels which use ammunition instead of heat & accuracy but allow a player to shoot to the best of their ability rather than the character's. That said, it's not terrible. Sifting through the inventory is messy, the APC handles awkwardly to say the least, but I enjoyed the vehiclar sequences none the less. Unless you just stand still to take an explosion to the face or get reckd by a Thresher Maw, it's pretty hard to die on normal outside of 'noob mistakes'. Load times can be a bit lengthy.   Overall a very satisfying experience that improves gameplay wise as the series progresses.

Mass Effect is one of the most top notch sci-fi RPGs to date. Beautifully crafted by the guys over at Bioware, this story will suck you in until you've lost the track of time. I can guarantee that you'll play way more than once, just to relive those epic and heartful moments this game never fails to deliver. The characters, the lore, the settings...everything feels perfect. The best part is it doesn't end with this game, so if you want to get some Mass Effect 2 and beyond goin, this is a must to play first. It's an experience you won't regret. Now go save the galaxy!

Mass Effect is one of those games that will live forever.It may have a few flaws but it is absolutely fantastic.  Positives -Fantastic Story -Great Characters -Interesting and well written dialogue -Good RPG elements  Negatives -Clunky movement -Backtracking -Copy Paste locations for side missions  Overall a fantastic game and if you can buy the 2nd game because your choices will carry over.

If you haven't played Mass Effect by this point, then you gotta trust me; it holds up incredibley well. Honestly, this is still my favourite 'space opera' game ever. KOTOR comes close... but if you want a large selection of galaxies, a superb story, lots of engaging side missions, interesting allys, meaningful decisions, good controls, voice acting AND character progression, this games does it all in my opinion.
